name: fs.constants
summary: commonly used constants for file system operations

constants.name: COPYFILE_EXCL
constants.summary: The copy operation will fail if dest already exists.

constants.name: F_OK
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the file is visible to the calling process. This is useful for determining if a file exists, but says nothing about rwx permissions. Default if no mode is specified.

constants.name: O_APPEND
constants.summary: Flag indicating that data will be appended to the end of the file.

constants.name: O_CREAT
constants.summary: Flag indicating to create the file if it does not already exist.

constants.name: O_DIRECTORY
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the open should fail if the path is not a directory.

constants.name: O_DSYNC
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the file is opened for synchronized I/O with write operations waiting for data integrity.

constants.name: O_EXCL
constants.summary: Flag indicating that opening a file should fail if the O_CREAT flag is set and the file already exists.

constants.name: O_NOCTTY
constants.summary: Flag indicating that if path identifies a terminal device, opening the path shall not cause that terminal to become the controlling terminal for the process (if the process does not already have one).

constants.name: O_NOFOLLOW
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the open should fail if the path is a symbolic link.

constants.name: O_NONBLOCK
constants.summary: Flag indicating to open the file in nonblocking mode when possible.

constants.name: O_RDONLY
constants.summary: Flag indicating to open a file for read-only access.

constants.name: O_RDWR
constants.summary: Flag indicating to open a file for read-write access.

constants.name: O_SYMLINK
constants.summary: Flag indicating to open the symbolic link itself rather than the resource it is pointing to.

constants.name: O_SYNC
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the file is opened for synchronized I/O with write operations waiting for file integrity.

constants.name: O_TRUNC
constants.summary: Flag indicating that if the file exists and is a regular file, and the file is opened successfully for write access, its length shall be truncated to zero.

constants.name: O_WRONLY
constants.summary: Flag indicating to open a file for write-only access.

constants.name: R_OK
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the file can be read by the calling process.

constants.name: S_IFBLK
constants.summary: File type constant for a block-oriented device file.

constants.name: S_IFCHR
constants.summary: File type constant for a character-oriented device file.

constants.name: S_IFDIR
constants.summary: File type constant for a directory.

constants.name: S_IFIFO
constants.summary: File type constant for a FIFO/pipe.

constants.name: S_IFLNK
constants.summary: File type constant for a symbolic link.

constants.name: S_IFMT
constants.summary: Bit mask used to extract the file type code.

constants.name: S_IFREG
constants.summary: File type constant for a regular file.

constants.name: S_IFSOCK
constants.summary: File type constant for a socket.

constants.name: S_IRGRP
constants.summary: File mode indicating readable by group.

constants.name: S_IROTH
constants.summary: File mode indicating readable by others.

constants.name: S_IRUSR
constants.summary: File mode indicating readable by owner.

constants.name: S_IRWXG
constants.summary: File mode indicating readable, writable, and executable by group.

constants.name: S_IRWXO
constants.summary: File mode indicating readable, writable, and executable by others.

constants.name: S_IRWXU
constants.summary: File mode indicating readable, writable, and executable by owner.

constants.name: S_IWGRP
constants.summary: File mode indicating writable by group.

constants.name: S_IWOTH
constants.summary: File mode indicating writable by others.

constants.name: S_IWUSR
constants.summary: File mode indicating writable by owner.

constants.name: S_IXGRP
constants.summary: File mode indicating executable by group.

constants.name: S_IXOTH
constants.summary: File mode indicating executable by others.

constants.name: S_IXUSR
constants.summary: File mode indicating executable by owner.

constants.name: UV_FS_COPYFILE_EXCL
constants.summary: alias for COPYFILE_EXCL?

constants.name: W_OK
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the file can be written by the calling process.

constants.name: X_OK
constants.summary: Flag indicating that the file can be executed by the calling process. This has no effect on Windows (will behave like fs.constants.F_OK).
